resources.string: This program allows overriding the battery charging current. Beware, that too high charging currents may harm the device where you plug the USB cable! The author of this application is not responsible for any damages caused! Settings will be immediately saved and are active until the phone is restarted.

This application controls the intel medfield battery charging driver. It needs the kernel patch from https://gist.github.com/NerdyProjects/91f466bfc98921945726 applied to work.
 Details:
 Your Phone will normally charge at rates of about 1A when connected to a charger which identifies itself by shorting the D+/D- lines of the USB cable.
 If it is connected to another USB port, it will only charge with less than 350 mA as some additional power is needed to operate the phone.
 This patch disables charger detection and sets a higher charging speed, no matter where the phone is connected to.
 This may lead to destruction of the USB port where you connect the phone to, therefore no responsibility is taken. Anyway, the risk is quite low and the author did not have any problem so far.
 What may occur are these USB overcurrent limits on newer computers. You can safely ignore them but the USB port may be powered down automatically until you replug the cable or restart the computer.

This application is open source, published unter the GPLv3. Please see https://github.com/NerdyProjects/RazrIChargeCurrent for sources and details. \n\n The application logo is done by http://thesquid.ink/ and licensed under CC BY 3.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).
